node.title: NT tourism operators brand vaccination rules the 'worst Christmas present' as businesses try to stay afloat
node.alt: glowing red of Uluru at sunset
node.description: Tourism chiefs want the Northern Territory government to ease strict rules for visitors and residents, which they say will ruin Christmas for struggling tour operators and others in the industry.
node.content:
["Tourism chiefs\u00a0want the Northern Territory government to ease\u00a0strict rules for visitors and residents, which they say will ruin Christmas for tour operators and others in the industry.", "Among other regulations, from December 20 the NT government\u00a0wants vaccinated visitors to remain in approved high-vaccination zones for 14 days\u00a0on arrival in the Territory.", "Unvaccinated travellers from an orange zone will be banned from entering the Territory unless they\u00a0have an approved reason for travel (returning resident or essential work purposes).", "If they\u00a0have an approved reason for travel and are unvaccinated they\u00a0will be required to quarantine at Howard Springs or Alice Springs for 14 days.", "Vaccinated people from red zones will not have to quarantine in Howard Springs or the Alice Springs facility. But they will\u00a0be required to do 14 days of self-quarantine at home or in another suitable location.", "Tourism Central Australia\u00a0(TCA) chief executive Danial Rochford said the rules\u00a0would stop visitors and residents from visiting key tourism destinations over the holiday period, including\u00a0Uluru, Kings Canyon and the east and west MacDonnell ranges.", "\"I've got a lot of very anxious and very concerned tourism operators,\" he said.\u00a0", "\"We're back to square one where businesses have really lost a lot of confidence and morale. I'm seeing a lot of mental health challenges.", "Mr Rochford said that\u00a0TCA had\u00a0written to Tourism Minister Natasha Fyles\u00a0calling for a central Australian tourism bubble.", "", "
Tourism Central Australia's Danial Rochford.(Supplied: Danial Rochford)
", "\"It would mean that people would be able to visit central Australia's key tourist icons,\" he said.", "He says\u00a0it will be a significant blow to the tourism industry if the requirement is not reversed.", "\"We're hopeful that government will listen to the concerns of the industry,\" he said.", "Mr Rochford said many operators were\u00a0distressed .", "\"It\u00a0is the\u00a0worst Christmas present the government could give us,\" he said.", "\"The rollercoaster ride that this is just unbelievable for many small business owners.", "Mr Rochford is aslo calling on Alice Springs residents to approach the Chief Minister's office and the Minister for Tourism.", "\"This is the time for everyone to stand up and share their views and share their concerns.", "\"I think if we can collectively voice our views and government will listen,\" he said.", "", "
NT Health Minster Natasha Fyles.(ABC News: Hamish Harty)
", "
Undisclosed changes
", "Ms\u00a0Fyles said that changes would\u00a0be announced in the coming days to \"provide\u00a0certainty to Territorians who do wish to visit family and to state during the Christmas January holiday period.", "\"And of course for our tourism industry \u2014 whilst at the same time keeping our vulnerable communities and Territorians safe.", "Ms Fyles said the Territory was\u00a0transitioning from a pandemic footing to an endemic and the uncertainty would\u00a0continue.", "\"It has certainly been a very bumpy ride and unfortunately that will continue into the future,\" she said.", "\"But we will continue to listen closely to industry and work with them.\"", "", "
